title: Researchers Discover Dangerous Exposure of Sensitive Kubernetes Secrets
description:
Researchers at Aqua call urgent attention to the public exposure of Kubernetes configuration secrets, warning that hundreds of organizations are vulnerable to this “ticking supply chain attack bomb.”

The post Researchers Discover Dangerous Exposure of Sensitive Kubernetes Secrets appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: 185,000 Individuals Impacted by MOVEit Hack at Car Parts Giant AutoZone
description:
Car parts giant AutoZone says nearly 185,000 individuals were impacted by a data breach caused by the MOVEit hack.

The post 185,000 Individuals Impacted by MOVEit Hack at Car Parts Giant AutoZone  appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Windows Hello Fingerprint Authentication Bypassed on Popular Laptops
description:
Researchers have tested the fingerprint sensors used for Windows Hello on three popular laptops and managed to bypass them.

The post Windows Hello Fingerprint Authentication Bypassed on Popular Laptops appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Sam Altman is Back as OpenAI CEO Just Days After Being Removed, Along With a New Board
description:
San Francisco-based OpenAI has reached an agreement in principle for Sam Altman to return to OpenAI as CEO with a new initial board.

The post Sam Altman is Back as OpenAI CEO Just Days After Being Removed, Along With a New Board appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Microsoft Offers Up to $20,000 for Vulnerabilities in Defender Products
description:
Microsoft invites researchers to new bug bounty program focused on vulnerabilities in its Defender products.

The post Microsoft Offers Up to $20,000 for Vulnerabilities in Defender Products appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Humans Are Notoriously Bad at Assessing Risk
description:
When too much subjectivity is mixed into risk assessment, it can produce a risk picture that is not an accurate representation of reality. 

The post Humans Are Notoriously Bad at Assessing Risk appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Kansas Officials Blame 5-Week Disruption of Court System on ‘Sophisticated Foreign Cyberattack’
description:
Cybercriminals hacked into the Kansas court system, stole sensitive data and threatened to post it on the dark web in a ransomware attack that has hobbled access to records.

The post Kansas Officials Blame 5-Week Disruption of Court System on ‘Sophisticated Foreign Cyberattack’ appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Citrix, Gov Agencies Issue Fresh Warnings on CitrixBleed Vulnerability
description:
Administrators are urged to patch the recent CitrixBleed NetScaler vulnerability as LockBit starts exploiting it.

The post Citrix, Gov Agencies Issue Fresh Warnings on CitrixBleed Vulnerability appeared first on SecurityWeek.
